intro: Perebea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese perebea, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly found in Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
